response:
Urgent MRI is required to define the distribution, age and activity of CNS lesions and to exclude structural mass lesions. CSF analysis (including oligoclonal bands) and visual evoked potentials help confirm inflammatory demyelination and dissemination in time. Blood tests are needed both to rule out alternative metabolic, infectious and autoimmune causes and to provide a baseline prior to immunotherapy. Additional tests screen for mimics such as vasculitis, sarcoidosis and B12 deficiency, and for infections relevant to future disease-modifying therapies. Urine testing clarifies the suspected urinary tract infection before high-dose steroids.
